paper_abstract: In 1976, Helleseth conjectured that two binary m-sequences of length 2(m) - 1 can not have a three-valued crosscorrelation function when m is a power of 2. We show that this conjecture is true when - 1 is a correlation value. In other words, if C-1,C-k is the cyclic code of length 2(m) - 1 with two zeros alpha, alpha(k), where alpha is a primitive element of F-2m and gcd(k, 2(m) - 1) = 1, then its dual C-1,k(perpendicular to) can not have three weights when m is a power of 2.
paper_title: On cyclic codes of length 2(2r)-1 with two zeros whose dual codes have three weights
